Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A day in the life of a Data Analyst


Align with business stakeholders to understand and challenge their needs and requirements.
Define a suitable analytical approach to achieve a solution that fits the business need. This is then communicated in a clear and transparent way to the stakeholders.
Go over the execution phase, from gathering and exploring the data needed to applying the advanced analytics and statistical techniques needed.
Present outcome of the analytics delivery in the form of business focused insights and/or relevant dashboards
Contribute to the analytical community by sharing learnings and working on side-activities linked to craftmanship and tooling development.


How To Succeed

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.


Academic background in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or alike, and/or equivalent experience of 3 years
Past professional experience in analytics related role.
Technical skills in analytics leading to past successes. Such as experience with SQL, dashboarding and data visualization, Adobe analytics, Python.
Strong independence and drive to take ownership on tasks assigned: you will be cultivating analytics within the bank and help us in the journey to being data driven.
Be analytical: extremely curious, constantly looking for an explanation; analysing sharply, concise & to the point.


As a Data Analyst you will have the opportunity to:


Participate in courses and trainings within the analytical domain.
Challenging, strategic and highly visible projects to support or take the lead in.
Learn more about the various aspect of data analytics within the retail domain as possible projects range from credit risk, product, marketing, and segment related. Providing you with possibilities to broaden and deepen your knowledge.


The team

An informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavours.

We work in a progressive and agile way of working, where new ideas are valued ahead of convention. The team is composed of a mix of Data Analysts and Data Scientists and supported by both a Product Lead and Analytics translator. You will be joining us on our project-based way of working where most tracks are worked on by a small, dedicated team of 2-3 people mixing the roles available in the team with extra support from subject matter experts specific to the track. This project-based way of working also means you will have the possibility to work on different topics ranging from strategy defining deep dives, to more foundational building blocks of the bank, such as understanding and tracking evolution of customer feedbacks all the way to customer facing features of the app like transaction categorization.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Junior Data Analyst | MySQL & PowerBI (1y contract | Remote)
HTML:
iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 110K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions.
Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!

Your mission

We're looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in business KPIs optimization, and systems reconciliation. Will be in charge of:

  • Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps);
  • Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools;
  • Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling;
  • Interacting with different teams, especially the Software Development and Accounting ones.

Requirements


  • At least 1 year of experience in a similar role;
  • Sound knowledge of MySQL;
  • Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards);
  • Good Excel skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts);
  • Familiarity with general economics concepts;
  • Full professional proficiency in English.

Added values


  • Familiarity with statistics, predictive models, and AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.);
  • Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization);
  • Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards);
  • Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements;
  • Previous experience in a SaaS company.

Location

At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.

Benefits

REMOTE WORK - You can work 100% remotely or if you prefer, from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (Bologna and Milan), and Germany (Hamburg). We are used and fully structured to onboard people who prefer to work full-time remotely.
TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - We'll provide you with a budget so that you can spend time with your teammates based on the other side of the world;
COMPANY RETREATS AND COWORKING GATHERINGS - Once a year, we get together in amazing destinations to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long gatherings to places like Venice, Sicily, and the Dolomites.
LEARNING BUDGET - We'll sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget for certifications, events, courses, and books;
ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes weekly, within working hours, and on several different levels. We know there's always room to improve;
WORK EQUIPMENT - We'll provide an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best;
BRIGHT & COLLABORATIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team of talented and experienced colleagues. Along with that, you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere!
By applying, you hereby declare that you have read and understood our privacy policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/96274994).

Please send your CV in English.
Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at:
iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook |Twitter

R, Python, SAS, Power BI, SQL




Ready for your next challenge? Let's chat! Apply now and be part of something exciting in Brussels!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Requirements

What will you be bringing to the team?

Bachelor Degree in IT or related field and 13 years of experience in IT.
At least 3 years of specific expertise in data analysis and data visualisation.
Experience in Power BI and sharepoint.
Experience and knowledge of R (R studio).
Good knowledge of SQL and procedural language (f.i. in Access, Oracle or PostgreSQL).
Basic knowledge of scripting languages like Python, Bash and Windows JScript/VBScript.
Knowledge of developing interactive charts with the Highcharts library would be an advantage.
Knowledge of a programming language (f.i. C++, VB) would be an advantage.
Fluent in English at least at a level B1.




Thank you very much!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

About the European Climate Foundation

The European Climate Foundation (ECF) was founded in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help tackle climate change by fostering the development of a low-carbon society at the national, European, and global level.

We support over 1,000 partner organisations to carry out activities that contribute to the public debate on climate action, drive urgent and ambitious policy in support of the objectives of the Paris Agreement and help deliver a socially responsible transition to a net-zero emissions economy and sustainable society in Europe and around the world.

Position

Context of the role

The ECF, amid significant growth, is transforming its structure, processes, and data management to become a more collaborative and adaptive organisation.

The ECF IT department is empowering the organisation to build digital capabilities and allow ECF to thrive in the digital era. The key capabilities are structured around cross-functional teams tackling key areas - Digital Workplace, Business Applications, Data & Analytics, and Cybersecurity.

The ECF Data Strategy encompasses internal and external data sets from a vast partner ecosystem, aiming to build robust data foundations, for data management, data governance, and innovation.

The ECF Data Team plays a pivotal role in making the ECF more data-driven. Leading the implementation of the Data Strategy, the team works on data architecture, engineering, analytics, and visualization across the organization. The Data Team guides the internal data community to enhance alignment and data literacy throughout ECF.

ECF primarily uses Azure Cloud to host its infrastructure and applications, while also leveraging other technology platforms for innovative data projects.

About The Role

As Data Analyst, you are involved in the capturing and analysis of business needs and translating them to data collections, visualisations and applications. You are responsible for the creation and the continuous improvement of strategic reports and dashboards. You are member of ECF Data Team, reporting to the Data Team Manager.

You are a team player and able to align different stakeholders, in complex environment, and provide a clear path for delivering quality reporting. You support various business stakeholders across ECF programmes & operations to embrace data driven approaches. You have the ability to map business requirements and effectively translate them to data products.

Key Responsibilities

Working closely with ECF business stakeholders (Programmes, Strategic Partnerships, Learning and Impact, Network Analysis Unit, Finance, Grants Management, HR, etc), you are responsible of:

Data engineering


Identify internal data sources (locations/systems/DB) across the organisation, as well as external data sources (open data APIs)
Be able to select relevant data sources (internal and/or external) for each request/dashboard/analysis
Build, maintain, and improve key datasets
Automate and improve the process of data gathering and cleaning
Translate business requirements and match them to processes and data flows



Data analysis


Create reports and prepare (data-driven) recommendations to business stakeholders
Collaborate with relevant stakeholders (business analysts, subject matter experts, data engineers, architects, managers, C-level, etc.) across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights
Engage in statistical analysis to identify trends in datasets and use data visualization to represent these trends.



Change and learning


Support the development of detailed knowledge and documentation about various data sources, within the overall master data management landscape at ECF
Formulate lessons learned and use them as a leverage for the teamwork & projects



Requirements

Experience and competencies


University degree in engineering, economics or statistics
At least 2 years of relevant professional experience
Proven experience with Python, Power BI, SQL, knowledge of DAX and Power Query are required
A first experience with the Azure cloud environment is a strong advantage
Experience with relational databases is an advantage
First experience working with agile methodologies
Attention to details and strong problem solver
Good active listening and communication skills
Written and verbal communications in English, another European language is an asset
Passionate about climate action with a genuine interest in the mission and values of the ECF



Other information

What We Offer


The unique opportunity to work as part of a highly dynamic, international team who combine their passion to make a difference with a rigorous and results-oriented approach to work;
A high level or professionalism and the ability to work on best-in-class processes and systems in an organisation already recognised as an operational reference in the sector;
A flexible work environment and a space to develop and challenge yourself;
A learning organisation based on trust and openness, whichadaptsthe knowledgetransfer to your learning speed
A permanent employment contract



Location

Brussels, Belgium. Only candidates with the right to work in their location will be considered.

Start date

As soon as possible

How To Apply

Please upload your :


CV (in English)
cover letter (in English).



All applications will be treated confidentially. We will store your information in our internal database unless you specifically request otherwise.

Diversitystatement

We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our organisation. We strongly encourage

candidates from disadvantaged or marginalised backgrounds to apply
Show more

Other information

What We Offer

  • The unique opportunity to work as part of a highly dynamic, international team who combine their passion to make a difference with a rigorous and results-oriented approach to work;
  • A high level or professionalism and the ability to work on best-in-class processes and systems in an organisation already recognised as an operational reference in the sector;
  • A flexible work environment and a space to develop and challenge yourself;
  • A learning organisation based on trust and openness, whichadaptsthe knowledgetransfer to your learning speed
  • A permanent employment contract


Location

Brussels, Belgium. Only candidates with the right to work in their location will be considered.

Working closely with ECF business stakeholders (Programmes, Strategic Partnerships, Learning and Impact, Network Analysis Unit, Finance, Grants Management, HR, etc), you are responsible of:

Data engineering

Identify internal data sources (locations/systems/DB) across the organisation, as well as external data sources (open data APIs)
Be able to select relevant data sources (internal and/or external) for each request/dashboard/analysis
Build, maintain, and improve key datasets
Automate and improve the process of data gathering and cleaning
Translate business requirements and match them to processes and data flows

Data analysis

Create reports and prepare (data-driven) recommendations to business stakeholders
Collaborate with relevant stakeholders (business analysts, subject matter experts, data engineers, architects, managers, C-level, etc.) across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights
Engage in statistical analysis to identify trends in datasets and use data visualization to represent these trends.

Change and learning

Support the development of detailed knowledge and documentation about various data sources, within the overall master data management landscape at ECF
Formulate lessons learned and use them as a leverage for the teamwork & projects




Experience and competencies

University degree in engineering, economics or statistics
At least 2 years of relevant professional experience
Proven experience with Python, Power BI, SQL, knowledge of DAX and Power Query are required
A first experience with the Azure cloud environment is a strong advantage
Experience with relational databases is an advantage
First experience working with agile methodologies
Attention to details and strong problem solver
Good active listening and communication skills
Written and verbal communications in English, another European language is an asset
Passionate about climate action with a genuine interest in the mission and values of the ECF




What we offer

The unique opportunity to work as part of a highly dynamic, international team who combine their passion to make a difference with a rigorous and results-oriented approach to work;
A high level or professionalism and the ability to work on best-in-class processes and systems in an organisation already recognised as an operational reference in the sector;
A flexible work environment and a space to develop and challenge yourself;
A learning organisation based on trust and openness, which adapts the knowledge transfer to your learning speed
A permanent employment contract




Location

Brussels, Belgium. Only candidates with the right to work in their location will be considered.




Start date

As soon as possible




How to apply

Please upload your :

CV (in English)
cover letter (in English).

All applications will be treated confidentially. We will store your information in our internal database unless you specifically request otherwise.




Diversity statement

We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our organisation. We strongly encourage

candidates from disadvantaged or marginalised backgrounds to apply

Show more
HTML:
About the European Climate Foundation

The European Climate Foundation (ECF) was founded in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help tackle climate change by fostering the development of a low-carbon society at the national, European, and global level.

We support over 1,000 partner organisations to carry out activities that contribute to the public debate on climate action, drive urgent and ambitious policy in support of the objectives of the Paris Agreement and help deliver a socially responsible transition to a net-zero emissions economy and sustainable society in Europe and around the world.


Context of the role

The ECF, amid significant growth, is transforming its structure, processes, and data management to become a more collaborative and adaptive organisation.

The ECF IT department is empowering the organisation to build digital capabilities and allow ECF to thrive in the digital era. The key capabilities are structured around cross-functional teams tackling key areas - Digital Workplace, Business Applications, Data & Analytics, and Cybersecurity.

The ECF Data Strategy encompasses internal and external data sets from a vast partner ecosystem, aiming to build robust data foundations, for data management, data governance, and innovation.

The ECF Data Team plays a pivotal role in making the ECF more data-driven. Leading the implementation of the Data Strategy, the team works on data architecture, engineering, analytics, and visualization across the organization. The Data Team guides the internal data community to enhance alignment and data literacy throughout ECF.

ECF primarily uses Azure Cloud to host its infrastructure and applications, while also leveraging other technology platforms for innovative data projects.


About the role

As Data Analyst, you are involved in the capturing and analysis of business needs and translating them to data collections, visualisations and applications. You are responsible for the creation and the continuous improvement of strategic reports and dashboards. You are member of ECF Data Team, reporting to the Data Team Manager.

You are a team player and able to align different stakeholders, in complex environment, and provide a clear path for delivering quality reporting. You support various business stakeholders across ECF programmes & operations to embrace data driven approaches. You have the ability to map business requirements and effectively translate them to data products.


Key responsibilities

Working closely with ECF business stakeholders (Programmes, Strategic Partnerships, Learning and Impact, Network Analysis Unit, Finance, Grants Management, HR, etc), you are responsible of:

Data engineering

  • Identify internal data sources (locations/systems/DB) across the organisation, as well as external data sources (open data APIs)
  • Be able to select relevant data sources (internal and/or external) for each request/dashboard/analysis
  • Build, maintain, and improve key datasets
  • Automate and improve the process of data gathering and cleaning
  • Translate business requirements and match them to processes and data flows

Data analysis

  • Create reports and prepare (data-driven) recommendations to business stakeholders
  • Collaborate with relevant stakeholders (business analysts, subject matter experts, data engineers, architects, managers, C-level, etc.) across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights
  • Engage in statistical analysis to identify trends in datasets and use data visualization to represent these trends.

Change and learning

  • Support the development of detailed knowledge and documentation about various data sources, within the overall master data management landscape at ECF
  • Formulate lessons learned and use them as a leverage for the teamwork & projects


Experience and competencies

  • University degree in engineering, economics or statistics
  • At least 2 years of relevant professional experience
  • Proven experience with Python, Power BI, SQL, knowledge of DAX and Power Query are required
  • A first experience with the Azure cloud environment is a strong advantage
  • Experience with relational databases is an advantage
  • First experience working with agile methodologies
  • Attention to details and strong problem solver
  • Good active listening and communication skills
  • Written and verbal communications in English, another European language is an asset
  • Passionate about climate action with a genuine interest in the mission and values of the ECF


What we offer

  • The unique opportunity to work as part of a highly dynamic, international team who combine their passion to make a difference with a rigorous and results-oriented approach to work;
  • A high level or professionalism and the ability to work on best-in-class processes and systems in an organisation already recognised as an operational reference in the sector;
  • A flexible work environment and a space to develop and challenge yourself;
  • A learning organisation based on trust and openness, which adapts the knowledge transfer to your learning speed
  • A permanent employment contract


Location

Brussels, Belgium. Only candidates with the right to work in their location will be considered.


Start date

As soon as possible


How to apply

  • CV (in English)
  • cover letter (in English).

candidates from disadvantaged or marginalised backgrounds to apply

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You’re an original. So are we.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labour and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For nearly 170 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen®, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ and Beyond Yoga.

Levi’s is looking for a Data Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the LSE merchandise and inventory management data analytics team. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools.

Who We Are Looking For

You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations, You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.

About The Job


Conduct analysis on complex retail data. Measure and track data created by data products, and convert them to key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve data quality, data analysis and business debugging.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Looker and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Google BigQuery, MSsql, dbt)
Experience with data integration tools such as Dataiku or Data Fusion is a plus
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data such as sales, inventory management, planning etc. retail knowledge is a plus
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.





The Impact You’ll Make in this Rol

eAs a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world

.Here, you will make an impact by

:Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights
.Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management
.Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies
.Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise
.Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives




.
Your Skills and Experti

seTo set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualification

s:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related fiel
d.Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industr
y.Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision makin
g.Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a mu
stCommunication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to client




s.
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role inclu

de:Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power
BI.Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniqu
es.Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiativ




es.
Supporting Your Well-b

eing3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and sc




ope.
Resources fo

r YouFor more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career




Page.

As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. Title: Data analyst (BI)
Description:
Omschrijving

De eindgebruiker wordt ondersteund in het lezen en begrijpen van de aangeleverde rapporten. Het team staat eveneens in voor het actueel en beschikbaar houden van de gebruikte infrastructuur en software.

Verantwoordelijkheidsdomein 1::

Het implementeren van adequate en innovatieve oplossingen op het gebied van de technische infrastructuur om aan de verwachtingen van de klant te voldoen. Bijhorende taken o.a. zijn:


Analyseren van de vraag van de klant en het identificeren van de huidige en toekomstige noden.
Opzetten en analyseren van de verschillende technische infrastructuurvoorstellen die ook voldoen aan de huidige normen.
Rekening houden met elementen zoals continuïteit, veiligheid, performantie en beschikbaarheid
De documentatie opstellen en de controlepunten opstellen/valideren



Verantwoordelijkheidsdomein 2:

Bijdragen aan het operationeel beheer van de infrastructuur zodat de continuïteit van de dienst verzekerd wordt.

Bijhorende taken o.a. zijn:


Nagaan of de technische infrastructuren goed werken
De change requests uitvoeren



Profiel


Hogere opleiding (Master of Bachelor) met technische/engineering achtergrond of gelijkwaardig door ervaring met ICT- technologie waarvoor expertise gevraagd wordt
Je kan met BI tools (PowerBI, Oracle BI) overweg en SQL heeft geen geheimen voor jou.
Kennis van XML, sterschema's



Noodzakelijke gedragscompetenties:


Communicatief
Probleemoplossend vermogen
Analytische vaardigheden
Zelfstandig kunnen werken
Teamspeler
Creatief
Innovatie gericht
Presentatie vaardigheden



Aanbod

Je word deel van een groeiende KMO met ruimte voor initiatief en persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Wij zorgen ervoor dat je in een uitdagende maar aangename werkomgeving terecht komt met leuke collega's. Samen met jou stippelen we een carriereplan uit, met aandacht en budget voor bijkomende opleidingingen / certificaties. Je kan rekenen op een motiverend salaris, aangevuld met extralegale voordelen, inclusief bedrijfswagen (of alternatieve vergoeding).

(Freelance ook mogelijk)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken
Show more

  • Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
  • Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
  • Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
  • Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
  • Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
  • Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.

We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden

  • Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
  • Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
  • Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
  • Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
  • Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
  • Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
  • Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
  • Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.

Wat kun je van ons verwachten?

  • Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
  • Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
  • Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
  • Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
  • Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
  • Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken

Data at Wooclap is important to empower other teams and to take informed decisions such as improving the product, understand our weaknesses and opportunities, etc.





The data team is expanding to meet the new challenges imposed by Wooclap’s growth. Our sector moves fast, and so do we: we remain on the cutting edge, with this in mind, we are looking for our new data analyst to join us. A number of new challenges are ahead of us, and if you are comfortable with a growing team that places innovation at the heart of its development, then this position is for you

Title: Data Analyst (Financial – Insights) - Freelance
Description:
Data Analyst (Financial – Insights) - Freelance

A customer of ours in the financial services sector in Brussels are looking for Medior Data Analyst to join as a freelance consultant.




They are looking to optimise their chatbot projects and need a polyvalent data analyst to work in excel to deal with their incoming/outgoing data, with a view to optimise the link between their chatbot and mobile banking journey.




The client needs a Dutch speaking candidate for the role due to the nature of the data.




Role:

Collect, process, and analyze large datasets related to the chatbot and mobile banking interactions.
Develop insights to optimize the mobile banking user experience, with a focus on improving chatbot efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Create data reports, visualizations, and dashboards primarily using Excel.
Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and timely reporting of incoming and outgoing data.
Provide recommendations to enhance the customer journey within the mobile banking platform.




Requirements:

3+ Years as a Data Analyst profile
Proficiency in Excel
Dutch speaking




Additional Details

START DATE: ASAP

DURATION: EOY + Extensions

CONTRACT: Freelance

LOCATION: Brussels

ONSITE POLICY: Flexible

HOURS PER WEEK: 40

LANGUAGES: Dutch

INTERVIEW PROCESS: 1 Stage

If you are interested, please forward your updated resume to josh.hay@vividresourcing.com to be considered.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
For a good client, we are looking for a BI Analyst.

As a BI Analyst, you play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the company. You'll collaborate with different departments to translate their needs into clear reports and dashboards.

In partnership with external experts, you'll ensure the data model evolves alongside our business processes. You'll also be responsible for the continuous development of the Azure data warehouse, keeping it aligned with the latest technological advancements. Clear documentation will be a critical part of your role to ensure all stakeholders can make the most of our data infrastructure.

Who are you?

You hold a degree in IT or have equivalent experience.
You are fluent in French or Dutch, with a good command of the second language.
You have excellent analytical and communication skills.
Proficiency in SQL, DAX, Power BI, and data modeling (Kimball) is essential.
You have at least 3 years of experience developing and implementing BI solutions.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, and Azure Synapse is a plus.

What does they offer you?

A competitive salary with additional benefits like a company car, meal vouchers, and group insurance.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth through various training programs and specializations.
A dynamic work environment with a family-oriented culture that emphasizes collaboration.
Flexible working hours, remote working options, and 12 extra vacation days, ensuring a healthy work-life balance.

Apply now and join the team as a BI Analyst!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Company

The Miraclon IT team strives to create value for our business from information technology. We manage a portfolio of software applications supporting business processes across regions and functions. We are responsible for the selection and delivery of new solutions, the continuous improvement of existing applications, as well as the day-to-day support.


About the company

Miraclon is the home of FLEXCEL Solutions, which have helped transform flexographic printing for more than a decade. The technology, including the industry-leading FLEXCEL NX and FLEXCEL NX Ultra Systems, and FLEXCEL NX Print Suite that enables PureFlexo™ Printing, maximizes on-press efficiency, delivers higher quality and overall best-in-class results. With a focus on pioneering image science, innovation, and collaboration with industry partners and customers, Miraclon is committed to the future of flexo and continues to be positioned to lead the charge. Find out more at www.miraclon.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and YouTube. Miraclon is a former division of The Eastman Kodak Company and was purchased by Montagu Private Equity in 2019.


Function

Reports to: Application & BI Manager


Scope: the global IT Departement is located in Zaventem. The entire time employs around 15 people who are helping the business of around 500 IT users across the globe.

We are hiring a Senior Business Intelligence & Data Analyst to join our global IT organization based in Zaventem, Belgium. He/she will work closely with the different business functions and our external BI support & development partner to turn transactional data into information that can be used to efficiently make business decisions. This position plays an essential role in the development of dashboards that visualize data to drive actionable insights, and reports to the Business Applications Manager – ERP & BI.


Responsibilities

  • Facilitate the gathering and documentation of business requirements together with business process owners and subject matter experts;
  • Analyze and challenge functional requirements, and participate in the development of business cases for process and IT system changes;
  • Lead the full software development lifecycle, from analysis to development & testing until go-live and aftercare;
  • Write clear and well-structured system specifications for change requests or new functionalities, and work with external developers to deliver these efficiently and effectively, with high quality;
  • Validate new solution design proposals with IT Architecture & Security to ensure that they are in line with Miraclon’s enterprise architecture and security guidelines;
  • Provide end user support (including access management) for reports and dashboards, through the IT incident management process and tool;
  • Report bugs and issues to the external support partner and follow through until resolution;
  • Prepare and deliver training sessions to subject matter experts for new dashboards or releases;
  • Act as back-up for master data maintenance.


Profile

For this role we are looking for someone with following experience:

Education requirements

  • University degree in Business Economics, Computer Science or similar;
  • Fluent in English (both written and oral); other languages are a plus.

Experience requirements:

  • Extensive experience with data platforms (preferably Microsoft Fabric and/or Azure Synapse) and BI solutions (preferably Microsoft Power BI);
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence & data concepts and market trends;
  • Broad knowledge of business processes, preferably from an international manufacturing or services environment.

Personality requirements:

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills;
  • Customer focused, enthusiastic and professional;
  • Good communication skills (both listening and presenting);
  • Result driven, detail oriented and quality focused;
  • Able to quickly integrate into a global, virtual team;
  • Encourage knowledge sharing between colleagues;
  • A sound interest in innovation and new technologies;
  • A strong belief that there is always a better way!


Miraclon is dedicatedly working with Everest Recruitment for this role. If you are interested in learning more you can apply on this add or send your resume directly to: herbert.martens@everest-recruitment.be

Title: Data Business Analyst
Description:
Fondée en 2020 en Belgique, ATS4IT fait partie du groupe Moongy, créé pour renforcer la présence d'agap2IT en Europe.

Depuis 2021, nous avons poursuivi notre expansion avec l'ouverture de notre succursale danoise à Copenhague et de notre marque espagnole à Madrid, réaffirmant ainsi notre engagement à être un acteur clé du paysage technologique européen.

Proximité, transparence et collaboration définissent notre approche chez ATS. Nous visons à être votre partenaire de confiance et le premier choix pour relever vos défis technologiques.

Rôle: Data Business Analyst

Localisation : Bruxelles

Type : Hybride (2-3 jours au bureau du client)

Langues : Français OU Néerlandais + Anglais

Les candidats doivent déjà résider dans l'Union Européenne et posséder un passeport/ permis de travail de l'Union Européenne (obligatoire).

Exigences


Expérience préalable en tant que Data Business Analyst (au moins 4 ans)
Expérience antérieure avec SAP
Maîtrise des langages de modélisation (SQL/Python) et de la manipulation des données.
Expérience dans le développement ou l'utilisation de solutions BI.
Expertise en principes de visualisation des données et meilleures pratiques.
Familiarité avec les technologies Big Data.
Bonne compréhension des solutions de Data Warehouse (modélisation dimensionnelle, ETL, modèle de données d'entreprise, etc.).
Connaissance des principes de Machine Learning et des différentes techniques de modélisation.
Fort sens des affaires et curiosité, soutenus par des compétences techniques en matière de données, permettant des analyses claires et exploitables pour les parties prenantes.
Excellentes compétences analytiques avec précision et attention aux détails.
Capacité à communiquer efficacement avec des publics à la fois techniques et orientés business.



Mission


Soutenir le département de la chaîne d'approvisionnement dans la conversion de leurs cas d'utilisation et de leurs demandes en rapports et analyses exploitables.
Réaliser des analyses d'impact et traduire les besoins en rapports et analyses en exigences de données.
Effectuer des analyses exploratoires des données et présenter des données/insights sous le format le plus approprié (tableaux de bord, BI en libre-service, jeux de données, etc.).
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour garantir une compréhension claire des solutions livrées.



Ce que nous offrons


Assurance DKV
Formations gratuites (techniques, comportementales, linguistiques) et certifications
Accompagnement continu et personnalisé pour la progression de votre carrière
Opportunités de travailler sur des projets utilisant des technologies de pointe
Accès à un réseau mondial d'entreprises avec des projets stimulants dans différents marchés européens.



Chez ATS4IT, membre de la famille agap2IT, nous promouvons l'égalité et valorisons la diversité. Nous favorisons un environnement sûr et inclusif où les opportunités sont égales pour tous. Nous accueillons les candidatures de personnes de tous horizons, basées uniquement sur le mérite.

Rejoignez-nous et faites partie de l'avenir !

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.


What You'll Bring To The Team


At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you’ll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you’ll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria’s diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data transformation, data foundation, and more
You engage with customers about their needs and understand their business requirements
You collect and analyze data
You match customer demand with meaningful data
You create analyses which generate efficient and effective user solutions
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria’s portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You have at least 2 years of data analysis and design experience
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analyst – Talent Pool
Description:
Are you an experienced data analytics and visualisation professional? Subscribe here and be the first to get notified when we open this position.

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 500 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specialisations involving data solutions in almost every relevant technology, both in the cloud and otherwise. At Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going.

We are focused on fast change and impactful technologies that make such change possible. We employ 2000+ top-notch tech professionals across the Nordics and West Europe, of which almost 80 in Belgium.

As the Belgian market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our Belgian team with new talent. You will be working in our Leuven or Ghent offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful.

While we don’t have an open position right now, we are proactively building a pool of qualified candidates for future Data Analyst roles. By joining our talent pool, you'll be among the first we reach out to when a suitable opportunity becomes available!

At Solita, our focus is on empowering our clients to make data-driven decisions through insightful analysis and effective data visualizations. We take a technology-agnostic approach, selecting the right tools based on the client’s specific needs rather than being tied to any one platform. While Power BI and Tableau are common in our projects due to their robust capabilities, the key lies in transforming data into actionable insights that truly impact business outcomes.

What do our Data Consultants do?

At Solita, we believe that data tells a story, and our job is to help our clients understand that story. We don’t stick to just one tool or technology; instead, we focus on what works best for each client, tailoring our approach to their specific needs. While we often use tools like Power BI and Tableau, what matters most to us is how well we can help our clients make sense of their data and use it to make informed decisions.

In This Role

Your main focus will be on helping clients translate raw data into meaningful insights. You’ll work closely with them to understand their challenges, dive deep into their data, and create visualizations that don’t just look good but actually help solve real business problems. You’ll also have a network of over 600 data and integration experts to lean on, so you’ll always have support when you need it.

We’re Looking For Someone Who


Loves working with data: Whether it’s through Power BI, Tableau, or another tool, you’re passionate about making data easy to understand and act on.
Thinks like an analyst: You enjoy digging into data and finding patterns, trends, and insights that others might miss.
Knows their way around the data lifecycle: From collecting data to analyzing it and visualizing the results, you’re comfortable with the whole process.
Is comfortable with SQL: You know how to connect different data sources and make sure the data is clean and ready to be analyzed.
Sees automation as a plus: If you’ve got experience with Python or another tool for automating tasks, that’s great, but it’s not a deal-breaker.
Enjoys working with clients: You like collaborating with clients, listening to their needs, and helping them see how data can solve their problems.
Is a team player: You enjoy working with others, sharing knowledge, and learning together. You’re also comfortable guiding and training clients when needed.
Speaks Dutch or French, and English: You’re fluent in these languages, which helps you connect with our diverse clients.



At Solita, we care about creating a supportive, easy-going work environment where people can be themselves. We’re passionate about what we do and always looking for ways to improve. If you value collaboration, curiosity, and making an impact through data, we’d love to hear from you.

What We Offer


Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Possibility to learn and work with the latest technologies/tools
Nordic work culture of autonomy and professionalism
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
Caring community of 2000+ tech expert colleagues across Northern Europe 



We believe diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience, and performance.

INTERESTED TO HEAR MORE?

You can subscribe yourself in this talent pool, A recruiter will reach out to you for more details and you will be notified once the position is open.
Show more

We believe diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. You can subscribe yourself in this talent pool, A recruiter will reach out to you for more details and you will be notified once the position is open.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Every day, the Group's 28,000 consultants and specialists aim to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector bodies and society as a whole: solutions that contribute to performance, innovation and the common good.

Present in 19 countries, close to the regions, and with its major software publisher partners, Inetum meets the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition to grow and industrialize, Inetum generated sales of €2.5 billion in 2023.

In response to a market that has been growing steadily for over 30 years, Inetum has made the deliberate choice to refocus on 4 core businesses in order to gain strength and offer customized solutions tailored to the specific needs of its customers: consulting (Inetum Consulting), infrastructure and application management (Inetum Technologies), software implementation (Inetum Solutions) and its own software publishing business (Inetum Software). Inetum has forged strategic partnerships with 4 of the world's leading software publishers - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft and SAP - and is pursuing a dedicated acquisition strategy to become one of Europe's top 5 in these technologies, and offer the best expertise to its customers.

At Inetum Belgium, we offer more than just a job; we provide an inspiring environment and opportunities for growth and development. We strive to create a workplace where you can harness your talents, contribute to challenging projects, and be part of a leading IT consultancy group.

Job Description

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.

A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.

As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.

You have experience in one or more of these domains:


You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)


Qualifications


You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years’ experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow…)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).


You Get Bonus Points If


You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops


Additional Information

Discover Your Future with Inetum Belgium


Make a Difference with a Meaningful Career: step into a role where your work truly matters. At Inetum Belgium, you’ll have the chance to impact lives and drive meaningful change every day.
Grow and Evolve Professionally: embrace a culture of continuous learning and development. We offer a range of training opportunities designed to help you expand your skills and advance your career.
Unlock Relevant Career Opportunities: pursue the career path you’ve always dreamed of with tailored opportunities and the IT expertise you need to succeed.
Achieve Work-Life Balance: we value your well-being. Enjoy flexible working hours, the convenience of satellite offices, the comfort of home working, and an informal, no-nonsense environment.
Enjoy Generous Annual Leave: life is more than just work. Take advantage of 32 days of annual leave to relax and recharge.
Travel in Comfort: forget the hassle of commuting. We provide a company car and a national fuel/charging card to keep you on the move. Prefer a different option? You can choose a mobility allowance instead.
Comprehensive Insurance Coverage: your health and security are our priorities. Benefit from group insurance and hospitalization insurance that show we care.
Attractive Compensation Package: we offer a competitive gross salary to recognize and appreciate your hard work.
Show more

Title: Medior Data Analyst - Financial Sector
Description:
Maximize your impact

About the Challenge

About The Role

As a Medior Data Analyst in the financial sector, you will take on a key role in analyzing complex financial data to provide insights that drive decision-making and optimize business performance. You will work with large datasets, developing reports, and dashboards to help stakeholders understand key trends and improve financial processes. Your work will be crucial in shaping strategic financial initiatives through data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large financial datasets, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and data models that support financial decision-making.
Collaborate with business and finance teams to translate data into strategic recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by maintaining and improving financial databases and systems.
Conduct in-depth analyses on financial performance, forecasting, and risk management to support business initiatives.
Contribute to the automation of data processes and optimization of data workflows


Your Skills

Required Skills:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
Proven experience in data analysis, particularly within the financial sector.
Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel) and data visualization platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong understanding of financial processes, data modeling, and business intelligence.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English; additional languages are a plus.


Our offer

Our offer

Exellys, Part Of Projective Group Isn’t Your Typical Recruiting Or Consulting Agency, We’re a Different Breed. We Are a Talent Incubator, Which Is Every Bit As Cool As It Sounds. Here’s What You Can Expect From Us


You’ll join an awesome community and enter one of our Smart Programs, based on where you are in your career and where you want to go. Did we mention you’ll get a personal coach as well?
Next to a generous monthly salary, you'll receive a flexible mobility budget and tons of other benefits (pension, daily compensations, etc.)
You’ll spend most of the time at (y)our client’s, except for regular Projective Group trainings, fun events, tribe meet-ups, after works, knowledge sharing sessions, etc.
After two years of coaching and upskilling from Projective Group, you’ll get the opportunity to join (y)our client’s organization as an internal employee.
Show more

  • You’ll spend most of the time at (y)our client’s, except for regular Projective Group trainings, fun events, tribe meet-ups, after works, knowledge sharing sessions, etc.
  • After two years of coaching and upskilling from Projective Group, you’ll get the opportunity to join (y)our client’s organization as an internal employee.

Title: Audience Data Analist
Description:
Jouw uitdaging




Mediafin, de uitgever van onder andere De Tijd en L’Echo, zoekt een nieuwe Audience Data Analist om de redactie te ondersteunen bij de digitale strategie.




Je maakt deel uit van de redactie en bent het aanspreekpunt voor inzichten over het leesgedrag.
Je weet data-analyses op een toegankelijke en bruikbare manier te vertalen voor de redacties.
Je werkt nauw samen met het digitale distributieteam om de digitale distributiestrategie van onze journalistiek naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
In samenwerking met de data-analisten van het team lezersmarkt zet je complexe data om in strategische inzichten, maar je vindt ook in een handomdraai een antwoord op concrete cijfervragen over onze nieuwsbrieven, pushnotificaties, social media of website en app.
Je stuurt mee de ontwikkeling van de juiste tools en oplossingen aan om beter te kunnen voorzien in de data-behoeften van de redacties.




Jouw profiel




Je bent in staat data nauwkeurig te interpreteren en om te zetten in aanbevelingen die in lijn zijn met de noden en doelstellingen van onze redacties.
Je hebt ervaring met data-analyse en bent gebeten door digitale media.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring op een nieuwsredactie en kent de dynamiek die er leeft.
Je bent actiegericht met een scherp strategisch inzicht.
Je bent proactief en communicatief. Je kan complexe cijfers vertalen naar concrete inzichten en oplossingen.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van Excel; kennis van analytics tools (o.a.QlikSense en Metabase) en SQL is een meerwaarde.
Je bent een teamplayer en gaat heel vlot in overleg.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands en een goede kennis van het Frans, of omgekeerd.




We bieden je




Bij Mediafin kom je terecht in een succesvol mediabedrijf. Innovatie, ambitie en ondernemingszin maken deel uit van ons DNA. Talent vormt de kern van wie we zijn. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling, een fijne werksfeer en een aangename werkomgeving op de bruisende site van Tour & Taxis.

Show more
