Title: Lead Data Analyst (Circular Programs & Innovation)
Description:
In short

We are looking for an innovative and data-focused leader to drive the program objectives, measurement strategy, and analytics efforts for primarily Cyclon, our overarching circularity program. You will play a critical part in defining the success metrics, improving data quality, reporting, and providing insights that influence strategic decisions around the program. This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability and circular business models, coupled with expertise in data analysis and a strong growth-centric mindset.




Your mission

Collaborate with teams across e.g. Strategy, Innovation and Commercial to define clear Cyclon business objectives alongside the program execution and scaleup. Identify key improvement areas and act as the point of contact for measurement, data analytics, and research.
Lead efforts in defining and implementing customer journey tracking mechanisms that capture interactions and touchpoints across the entire Cyclon program lifecycle. Provide insights into customer feedback and engagement to optimize touchpoints and improve overall experience.
Work closely with the Cyclon core team to ensure the integrity of data collection and analysis around operational and customer experience (CX) metrics and derive insights that help drive the direction of the program. Assess the impact of our efforts and use internal and external insights (e.g. market data) to make suggestions on further growth opportunities.
Take ownership of assessing our existing Cyclon data landscape, then build and execute on blueprints for the future of our program reporting especially as it relates across sales channels. Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality, ensuring high-quality, actionable insights.
Define key KPIs and measures of success as well as establish the source of truth for performance reporting. Establish benchmarks and assess the commercial viability of both the existing program and new initiatives, and present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders to guide program evolution. Own standardized (e.g. monthly) reporting on the program and establish reporting frameworks for new programs.




Your story

You have 5+ years of experience as Data or Business Analyst in a Retail/Commercial/Consulting business, with experience in sustainable/circular programs a major plus.
You come with a clear understanding of the Commercial landscape including Ecommerce, merchandising, customer, product and brand KPIs.
You have experience translating strategy into action, building business cases and assessing feasibility of new business ventures using data and insights gathered from a variety of sources.
You are proficient in using query languages such as SQL, and have experience working with complex datasets. Experience with other analytical languages such as Python or R are considered a plus.
You are a strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator, with the ability to take workstream ownership, partner with different functions, and effectively move projects and topics forward.
You have experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau, to provide insightful dashboards and visualizations.
You have a very strong analytical and quantitative mindset with a demonstrated ability to interpret and leverage data to drive decision making.




What We Offer

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically – to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose.

On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.

This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. Title: Consulting & Analytics Summer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech’s and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age. Exemplary projects:


How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?


VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of an Intern Consultant:


Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Internal Visa projects and clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.


Visa’s Summer Intern Programme:

Our Summer Internship is an 11-week programme providing you the opportunity to experience all that Visa has to offer alongside completing challenging work, building your skillset, and networking with fellow interns and Visa employees. Throughout the internship you will work on BAU work within your team, be given an end-to-end project to complete and take part in a variety of trainings to increase your learning. You will also get the opportunity to take part in a global social impact case challenge as well as hearing from senior leaders through our Visa Executive Speaker Series. The internship is just the beginning of what we hope will be a lasting career at Visa! If you are successful throughout your internship, you could even secure a graduate role with us when you finish university.

Our 2 Summer Intern cohort dates are:


10th June- 22nd August
1st July – 19th September


By joining VCA as a Summer Intern you will:


Work alongside an experienced and dynamic team, as well as top clients, expanding your knowledge in the payments sector and our consulting practices.
Gain access to ad hoc training resources such as Buddy, Mentor, your own learning path, project coaching and more to accelerate your career plan, such as Visa University.
Develop your management consulting skills in a market leader consulting organization, with top-notch practices


Qualifications

Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Our campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our team to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We’re looking for the next generation of change agents – dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

Therefore, our requirements are few:


Be in your penultimate year of university, including any further master's degrees or courses. Meaning your education will be complete in 2026.
Full, permanent, right to work for the location you applying to. Visa will not provide sponsorship for this role.
Fluent in both English and local language
Interest in technology and the payments industry


Desired Skills:


Strong communication skills – Oral and written fluency in local language and English is required.
Curious mindset with an interest in solving problems alongside strong analytical and quantitative skills, driving insight from data analysis.
Proactive attitude with experience of being a self-starter, a willingness to learn and to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate.


Additional Information

If you require any support during the recruitment process for any reasons, including those related to a disability, please let us know and we will be in contact to discuss this with you.

This is a hybrid position, employees are expected to work from the office 3 days a week (determined by leadership/site),

Please submit your CV in English. 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It’s Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio - Internship
Description:
Profil du candidat


You enroll your last year of a Master's Degree in Engineering or Finance
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.
A tri-partite internship agreement is mandatory



The fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team. The position requires strong communication skills within the team, externally and with other departments within the organisation. Both industry and contractual deadlines need to be respected to meet all of the company’s obligations. Reporting and monitoring obligations per the Dodd-Frank Act, EMIR, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and to comply with other rules & regulations require diligence and attention to detail.

Activités

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore.

TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Your responsabilites:

As an Energy Data Portfolio Intern, your main responsibilities will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while comparing, checking, and cleaning verified data the accuracy daily and proper reflection in the energy data hub and ETRM.
Reading and understanding market specifications on system operator data with products managed by the business as it relates to imbalance calculation.
Analysing system operator data against client contracts to help identify data anomalies and inconsistencies.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analyst dashboards, reports and alerts on system operator allocation data quality as it relates to reconciliation and settlements.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of assets.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Contexte et environnement

The fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team. The position requires strong communication skills within the team, externally and with other departments within the organisation. Both industry and contractual deadlines need to be respected to meet all of the company’s obligations. Reporting and monitoring obligations per the Dodd-Frank Act, EMIR, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and to comply with other rules & regulations require diligence and attention to detail.
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

  • You enroll your last year of a Master's Degree in Engineering or Finance
  • Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.
  • A tri-partite internship agreement is mandatory


The fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team. The position requires strong communication skills within the team, externally and with other departments within the organisation. Both industry and contractual deadlines need to be respected to meet all of the company’s obligations. Reporting and monitoring obligations per the Dodd-Frank Act, EMIR, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and to comply with other rules & regulations require diligence and attention to detail.

Activités

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore.

TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Your responsabilites:

As an Energy Data Portfolio Intern, your main responsibilities will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while comparing, checking, and cleaning verified data the accuracy daily and proper reflection in the energy data hub and ETRM.
  • Reading and understanding market specifications on system operator data with products managed by the business as it relates to imbalance calculation.
  • Analysing system operator data against client contracts to help identify data anomalies and inconsistencies.
  • Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analyst dashboards, reports and alerts on system operator allocation data quality as it relates to reconciliation and settlements.
  • Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of assets.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.


Contexte et environnement

The fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team. The position requires strong communication skills within the team, externally and with other departments within the organisation. Both industry and contractual deadlines need to be respected to meet all of the company’s obligations. Reporting and monitoring obligations per the Dodd-Frank Act, EMIR, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and to comply with other rules & regulations require diligence and attention to detail.

Title: Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science
Description:
Job Title:

Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of commodities trading and data science?

At Gunvor, we're on a mission to empower the next generation of talent in the industry. Our Global Graduate Program is your gateway to an incredible adventure, where you'll build the skills and knowledge that will set you on the path to success.

Your role:

As a Quantitative Analysis/Data Scientist Graduate at Gunvor, you will play a crucial role in our data analytics and research team. This 12-month rotational program will provide you with hands-on experience in quantitative analysis, data science, and market research. You will have the opportunity to work on real projects and gain valuable insights into the commodities trading industry.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market data to identify trends and patterns.
Develop quantitative models and algorithms.
Collaborate with our market research team.
Gain exposure to trading strategies and risk management.



Qualifications:


Recent university's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
0-12 months of work experience (ideally in commodities).
Strong numerical aptitude and coding skills (Python, C#).
Proficiency in statistical analysis.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic market conditions.



What We Offer:


A structured and comprehensive training program.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities for personal and professional development.
A competitive compensation package.



Selection Process:

Our selection process is designed to find the brightest talents who are eager to embark on this incredible journey. Here's how it works:

Applications: We look forward to receiving your applications as of the 1st of October 2024.

Screening & Assessment (Up until December, 2024): Our recruiters will diligently screen applications as they are submitted and match the information to our selection criteria.


Assessment: If your application passes the initial review, you'll be invited to participate in our online assessments. Here, we get to see your numerical, cognitive, and problem-solving skills.
Initial Interview: Successful candidates from the assessments will proceed to an interview where we'll discuss your qualifications, experiences, and your passion for the commodities trading world.



Selection Days (January 2025): The final stage includes our face-to-face Selection Days, scheduled for January 2025. This is a fantastic opportunity for us to get to know you better, and for you to learn more about Gunvor.

If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Informatica Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Your skillset:


Should have 8-10 years of experience in Informatica PowerCenter/Data Quality
Should have good knowledge and understanding of Data Management, experience in data integration and data governance solutions (especially data quality), data warehousing / Big Data/ Hadoop / RDBMS, Data management tools and technologies implementation.
Should have strong communication skills and is able to liaise effectively with various teams
Team management & handling experience, able to work effectively with Offshore team


Your Key Responsibilities


Able to handle local data exceptions raised in central data platform and application-level data check failures and warnings
Monitor all data quality related exceptions irrespective of origination
Analyze root causes with support from Business Analyst, Product Owners & Business users
Liaise with Hosting services/Upstream/Downstream Application teams for respective DQ issues
Track data issues to remediate/closure e.g. revising threshold values or revisit validations rules or coordinating with Biz users and upstream system for changes into data feeds
Provide expertise and recommendations to team members in resolving DQ issues
Define process flow/work arounds for addressing known issues/errors, maintain documentation and initiate process improvements
Understand transactional and reference data and analyze/investigate DQ exceptions
Understanding of trade surveillance applications

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Your tasks:




Responsible for being the Product Owner of Analytic Platform
Assemble appropriate data to monitor key performance indicators
Offer optimal digital experience to internal users
Analyze and optimize the usability of digital systems using app and web analytics tools
Drive business insights through data modeling and machine learning techniques using Python/R and SQL
Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, ETL tools such as Prefect, Apache Airflow and AWS Glue







Your qualifications:




Experience with MS Power BI
Familiar with Azure cloud-based data infrastructure and services
Profound knowledge of app and web analytics tools and demonstrated skill and experience using these analytics to understand and optimize the usability of digital systems
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and ETL tools (e.g., Prefect, Apache Airflow, AWS Glue)
Familiarity with cloud-based data infrastructure and services (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure)
Experience with data modeling and machine learning techniques
Track record with Python/R and SQL to drive business insights.
Comfortable working with Git and the command line
Experience in the retail or the health sector is a plus.
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in German and English.
Strongly interested in Digital Health and in creating and shaping innovative solutions







Your benefits:




The chance to work on a leading analytic platform with an innovative and prestigious organization
A highly motivated team and an open way of communication

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Für unseren Kunden im Raum Zürich, suchen wir schnellstmöglich eine/n:




Data Engineer, 80-100% (w,m,d) - 7490




Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:

Sie organisieren den reibungslosen Betrieb der produktiven Datenbanken
Sie sind für die Monitoring & Alerting Infrastruktur für Datenbanken verantwortlich
Sie empfangen, bearbeiten Incidents und Fehlermeldungen aus den Applikationen gezielt und fachgerecht
Sie stellen sicher, dass die Deployment-Infrastruktur für Datenbanken funktioniert
Sie sorgen für die Weiterentwicklung und Stabilität des Daten-Synchronisations-Framework auf Basis vom SQL Server




Ihr Profil:

Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Sie haben langjährige Erfahrung mit Microsoft SQL Server in der Rolle als DBA
Sie punkten mit Expertise bei der Entwicklung von Stored Procedures in T-SQL sowie Query Optimierungen, Query Plans und Index Erstellung
Sie bringen Kenntnisse von SQL Azure mit sowie fundierte Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung
Sie begeistern sich für agile Projektarbeit und sind verhandlungssicher in Deutsch und Englisch




Vertragliches:

Festanstellung
Start: 01.10.2024 (oder nach Vereinbarung)
Ort: Zürich
Pensum: 100%




Ihre Benefits

Wir unterstützen unsere Mitarbeitenden dabei, ihre berufliche Entwicklung und ihr Privatleben in allen Lebensphasen optimal zu gestalten. Unsere attraktiven Leistungen wie die Möglichkeit der Heimarbeit, 25 bis 30 Urlaubstage, Prämienbeiträge in der 3. Säule und ein breites Angebot an Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten tragen dazu bei.




Wichtige Auskunft:

Bitte bewerben Sie sich nur auf diese Stelle, wenn Sie folgende Voraussetzungen erfüllen:

Einen europäischen Reisepass oder eine gültige Schweizer Arbeitsbewilligung
fliessend Deutsch sprechen







Kontakt

Als freundliche und dynamische IT-Personalberatung ist IT Di-Visions AG bei namhaften Kunden in der gesamten Schweiz sehr erfolgreich etabliert. Wir vermitteln IT-Experten sowohl für Projekte auf Zeit als auch für Stellen auf Dauer.




Herr Anj Carter steht Ihnen bei fachlichen Fragen unter der Tel. Nr. 044 213 20 30 gerne zur Verfügung.




IT Di-Visions AG

Bahnhofstrasse 63

8001 Zürich

aca@di-visions.ch

Tel +41 44 213 20 30

Fax +41 44 213 20 31

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Interested in Python/SQL/Azure/Spark tech stack? Apply now as we are currently looking for a Data Engineer in the Zurich area to join our client’s team.




In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure that enables emission monitoring algorithms. You will work on the quality and scalability of data pipelines, enabling customers to reduce their gas emissions.

You’ll work closely with a dynamic and interdisciplinary team of engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders. You’ll have the opportunity to work on the solution architecture and challenges of developing new IoT solutions.




The ideal candidate has a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data engineering, or a related field, solid experience in big data processing frameworks like Apache Spark, cloud data engineering (preferably on Azure), and proficiency in Python and SQL. Experience with CI/CD (GitHub Actions) and DevOps is an advantage.




As this is a German-speaking environment, German is required for day-to-day communications.




Just so you know, this position is limited to Swiss citizens, Swiss work permit holders without sponsorship, and residents of the EU/EFTA zone. Visa and permit sponsorship options are not available. Candidates without said requirements cannot be considered.




If you’re ready to be part of a dynamic team, send your CV to mateja.petrovic@nicollcurtin.com as we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team’s and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland – flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland – we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (Circular Programs & Innovation)
Description:
In short

We are looking for an innovative and data-focused leader to drive the program objectives, measurement strategy, and analytics efforts for primarily Cyclon, our overarching circularity program. You will play a critical part in defining the success metrics, improving data quality, reporting, and providing insights that influence strategic decisions around the program. This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability and circular business models, coupled with expertise in data analysis and a strong growth-centric mindset.




Your mission

Collaborate with teams across e.g. Strategy, Innovation and Commercial to define clear Cyclon business objectives alongside the program execution and scaleup. Identify key improvement areas and act as the point of contact for measurement, data analytics, and research.
Lead efforts in defining and implementing customer journey tracking mechanisms that capture interactions and touchpoints across the entire Cyclon program lifecycle. Provide insights into customer feedback and engagement to optimize touchpoints and improve overall experience.
Work closely with the Cyclon core team to ensure the integrity of data collection and analysis around operational and customer experience (CX) metrics and derive insights that help drive the direction of the program. Assess the impact of our efforts and use internal and external insights (e.g. market data) to make suggestions on further growth opportunities.
Take ownership of assessing our existing Cyclon data landscape, then build and execute on blueprints for the future of our program reporting especially as it relates across sales channels. Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality, ensuring high-quality, actionable insights.
Define key KPIs and measures of success as well as establish the source of truth for performance reporting. Establish benchmarks and assess the commercial viability of both the existing program and new initiatives, and present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders to guide program evolution. Own standardized (e.g. monthly) reporting on the program and establish reporting frameworks for new programs.




Your story

You have 5+ years of experience as Data or Business Analyst in a Retail/Commercial/Consulting business, with experience in sustainable/circular programs a major plus.
You come with a clear understanding of the Commercial landscape including Ecommerce, merchandising, customer, product and brand KPIs.
You have experience translating strategy into action, building business cases and assessing feasibility of new business ventures using data and insights gathered from a variety of sources.
You are proficient in using query languages such as SQL, and have experience working with complex datasets. Experience with other analytical languages such as Python or R are considered a plus.
You are a strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator, with the ability to take workstream ownership, partner with different functions, and effectively move projects and topics forward.
You have experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau, to provide insightful dashboards and visualizations.
You have a very strong analytical and quantitative mindset with a demonstrated ability to interpret and leverage data to drive decision making.




What We Offer

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically – to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose.

On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.

Show more
HTML:
In short

We are looking for an innovative and data-focused leader to drive the program objectives, measurement strategy, and analytics efforts for primarily Cyclon, our overarching circularity program. You will play a critical part in defining the success metrics, improving data quality, reporting, and providing insights that influence strategic decisions around the program. This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability and circular business models, coupled with expertise in data analysis and a strong growth-centric mindset.


Your mission

  • Collaborate with teams across e.g. Strategy, Innovation and Commercial to define clear Cyclon business objectives alongside the program execution and scaleup. Identify key improvement areas and act as the point of contact for measurement, data analytics, and research.
  • Lead efforts in defining and implementing customer journey tracking mechanisms that capture interactions and touchpoints across the entire Cyclon program lifecycle. Provide insights into customer feedback and engagement to optimize touchpoints and improve overall experience.
  • Work closely with the Cyclon core team to ensure the integrity of data collection and analysis around operational and customer experience (CX) metrics and derive insights that help drive the direction of the program. Assess the impact of our efforts and use internal and external insights (e.g. market data) to make suggestions on further growth opportunities.
  • Take ownership of assessing our existing Cyclon data landscape, then build and execute on blueprints for the future of our program reporting especially as it relates across sales channels. Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality, ensuring high-quality, actionable insights.
  • Define key KPIs and measures of success as well as establish the source of truth for performance reporting. Establish benchmarks and assess the commercial viability of both the existing program and new initiatives, and present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders to guide program evolution. Own standardized (e.g. monthly) reporting on the program and establish reporting frameworks for new programs.


Your story

  • You have 5+ years of experience as Data or Business Analyst in a Retail/Commercial/Consulting business, with experience in sustainable/circular programs a major plus.
  • You come with a clear understanding of the Commercial landscape including Ecommerce, merchandising, customer, product and brand KPIs.
  • You have experience translating strategy into action, building business cases and assessing feasibility of new business ventures using data and insights gathered from a variety of sources.
  • You are proficient in using query languages such as SQL, and have experience working with complex datasets. Experience with other analytical languages such as Python or R are considered a plus.
  • You are a strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator, with the ability to take workstream ownership, partner with different functions, and effectively move projects and topics forward.
  • You have experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau, to provide insightful dashboards and visualizations.
  • You have a very strong analytical and quantitative mindset with a demonstrated ability to interpret and leverage data to drive decision making.


What We Offer

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically – to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose.

On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst - Graduate (Hybrid, m/f/x/d)
Description:
We are looking for graduates with strong interpersonal skills, who are eager to learn, broaden their knowledge and expertise and want to make a difference. You have a Bachelor, Master, or PhD degree with less than 3 years of professional experience - we invite you to apply to our Graduate Programme which officially starts on 1 September 2025.

The programme offers you the chance to join the dynamic, fast-moving world of a leading risk knowledge organisation. Over an 18-month period, you will receive on- and off-the-job training, including a job rotation that gives you the opportunity to work across different lines of business and departments.

About The Team

The Market Risk Management (MRM) team within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department will be your homebase during the programme and you will also have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks total (possible destinations could, e.g., be Treasury / AM / other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). The market risk management team has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. The role will work across all three product areas within MRM, i.e., Credit & Equities; Treasury & Rates; and (Re)Insurance Transactions.

About The Role

The cross-functional role will involve deriving risk analytics and developing/maintaining various applications (dashboards, own R packages, APIs) for financial risk managers. The position holder will support the product areas in their regular responsibilities and deliverables and engage in a significant amount of project-based work.

Here are some areas you might focus on:

Scenario impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics using open-source or commercial frameworks Supporting the management reporting process through execution and enhancement of current reports Data integration across various of the Group's internal and external data sources Design and development of RShiny server dashboards Analysis of embedded financial market risks within reinsurance transactions using the in-house libraries

About You

Essentials:

Master's degree in quantitative subject (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance) Solid coding skills in at least one major data language (R and/or Python) (A lot of) intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics Fully proficient in English

Nice to Have:

Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc), treasury or within asset management within the banking or (re)insurance sector

Opportunities for Further Learning and Growth:

MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language REST APIs and querying them in R / Python Version control / Git Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, object-oriented programming (R6 classes), RShiny dashboards, Quarto, code parallelization etc Apache Spark / PySpark

Please note that the application process will be open until beginning of November. The active selection and interview process will start afterwards, and you may not hear from us in the meantime. This does not mean you application is ignored. Please keep this in mind in case you do not hear from us within upcoming weeks. We will keep you informed of any updates or changes to the schedule. Thank you for your understanding.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Title: Consulting & Analytics Summer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech’s and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age. Exemplary projects:


How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?


VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of an Intern Consultant:


Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Internal Visa projects and clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.


Visa’s Summer Intern Programme:

Our Summer Internship is an 11-week programme providing you the opportunity to experience all that Visa has to offer alongside completing challenging work, building your skillset, and networking with fellow interns and Visa employees. Throughout the internship you will work on BAU work within your team, be given an end-to-end project to complete and take part in a variety of trainings to increase your learning. You will also get the opportunity to take part in a global social impact case challenge as well as hearing from senior leaders through our Visa Executive Speaker Series. The internship is just the beginning of what we hope will be a lasting career at Visa! If you are successful throughout your internship, you could even secure a graduate role with us when you finish university.

Our 2 Summer Intern cohort dates are:


10th June- 22nd August
1st July – 19th September


By joining VCA as a Summer Intern you will:


Work alongside an experienced and dynamic team, as well as top clients, expanding your knowledge in the payments sector and our consulting practices.
Gain access to ad hoc training resources such as Buddy, Mentor, your own learning path, project coaching and more to accelerate your career plan, such as Visa University.
Develop your management consulting skills in a market leader consulting organization, with top-notch practices


Qualifications

Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Our campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our team to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We’re looking for the next generation of change agents – dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

Therefore, our requirements are few:


Be in your penultimate year of university, including any further master's degrees or courses. Meaning your education will be complete in 2026.
Full, permanent, right to work for the location you applying to. Visa will not provide sponsorship for this role.
Fluent in both English and local language
Interest in technology and the payments industry


Desired Skills:


Strong communication skills – Oral and written fluency in local language and English is required.
Curious mindset with an interest in solving problems alongside strong analytical and quantitative skills, driving insight from data analysis.
Proactive attitude with experience of being a self-starter, a willingness to learn and to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate.


Additional Information

If you require any support during the recruitment process for any reasons, including those related to a disability, please let us know and we will be in contact to discuss this with you.

This is a hybrid position, employees are expected to work from the office 3 days a week (determined by leadership/site),

Please submit your CV in English. 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community




TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com







If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam63@telusinternational.ai

Title: Data Engineer (80-100%)
Description:
Join our dynamic and innovative team as a Data Engineer! If you have experience with ETL/ELT processes, data modeling, and strong programming skills in SQL and Python, we would love to hear from you.

Help us leverage data to drive business insights and create meaningful solutions. We are looking for motivated individuals to contribute as Management Information Systems (MIS) specialists.

As a key member of our team, you will work with cutting-edge technologies such as cloud platforms, Snowflake, dbt, Oracle, MS SQL, SAP BW, SAP S/4HANA, and visualization tools like Tableau, IBM Cognos Analytics, and Power BI.

What would your role be?


Operate, maintain, and troubleshoot our platforms, including optimization, documentation, user support, and incident management.
Develop and maintain robust data pipelines.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, security, and regulatory compliance across the MIS infrastructure.
Contribute to solution development in an agile delivery environment.


What are we looking for?

Must-haves


University degree in computer science, data science, finance, or equivalent professional experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL and experience with dbt.
Familiarity with cloud technologies, preferably Microsoft Azure and Snowflake.
Proficiency in written and spoken German and English.


Nice-to-haves


Experience in Python programming.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.
Knowledge of 1: data modeling techniques (e.g., Inmon, Kimball, or Data Vault 2.0).
Experience in the financial industry.


You Are


Committed to delivering high-quality results and taking ownership of your work.
A proactive, motivated team player who values independent and reliable working styles.
Skilled in problem-solving and critical thinking.
Willing to bring new ideas to life and step outside your comfort zone to succeed.


What We Offer


We follow agile principles in our work and methodology, promoting mutual trust.
Teamwork is at our core: we regularly share knowledge and skills with each other as part of our "One Vontobel" approach.
Opportunities for ongoing education and professional development.
A collaborative work culture characterized by short communication channels and cross-departmental information exchange.
Flexible working hours, the option to work from home, diverse benefits, and a complimentary free first-class lunch menu when working in the office.


We are looking for talented people, not just a CV that ticks all the boxes. Even if you do not have absolutely everything we have asked for, if this role sounds like a good fit for you, we encourage you to apply.

At Vontobel, you are building better futures for our clients and society, as well as for yourself. By 2030, we want to be known as one of the leading and most trusted global investment firms. We have 2,300+ engaged professionals, based in over 25 locations globally and headquartered in Zurich.

We are both majority family-owned and publicly listed. Our capacity for long-term focus, on topics such as sustainability, is underpinned by the security of the family’s 100-year commitment. Driven by an ownership mindset, you can unlock your potential and translate insights into opportunities. We are hiring talented individuals who are determined to deliver in a changing world and who come from a wide variety of backgrounds.

Do you want to be Vontobel?

Thank you for applying to Vontobel. We will carefully review your application and will respond to you in a timely manner.

At Vontobel, we are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

We value the many voices within our teams and are committed to creating an environment where everyone who wants to be part of our performance culture can be themselves. It is based on mutual respect and zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.

If you have any questions you can contact us through our contact form.

We are both majority family-owned and publicly listed. Our capacity for long-term focus, on topics such as sustainability, is underpinned by the security of the family’s 100-year commitment. Driven by an ownership mindset, you can unlock your potential and translate insights into opportunities. We are hiring talented individuals who are determined to deliver in a changing world and who come from a wide variety of backgrounds.

Do you want to be Vontobel?

Thank you for applying to Vontobel. We will carefully review your application and will respond to you in a timely manner.

At Vontobel, we are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

We value the many voices within our teams and are committed to creating an environment where everyone who wants to be part of our performance culture can be themselves. It is based on mutual respect and zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.

If you have any questions you can contact us through our contact form.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

Title: Database engineer (80% - 100%)
Description:
At Vontobel, we are committed to actively shaping our future. We create and pursue investment opportunities that bring our clients ahead. As a global financial services provider with Swiss roots, we specialize in wealth management, active asset management and digital investment solutions.

Do you enjoy focusing on database topics?

Are you full of drive? And are you an experienced database specialist with a passion? Or have you just successfully completed your studies in computer science and also want to get to grips with innovative IT infrastructure technologies?

We are looking for a committed, motivated and communicative Database Engineer to join a highly effective database team in the Technology&Platforms department at our head quarter at Zurich.

Stable operation is not everything, but without stable operation everything is nothing. Therefore, as a Database Engineer you will work on various tasks. You will develop, maintain and operate the database platforms of two internally established database technologies such as Oracle and MS SQL Server as well as take on business-critical performance tuning tasks. In addition, you will provide automation for internal customer as a self-service. With your willingness to deal with a variety of technologies, you will take broad responsibility for ensuring established as well as new database services and drive them forward.

The highly automated platforms basically form a private cloud for databases as a manged PaaS, the use of which enables you to create and operate database services in an agile manner and with consistent quality.

You will work in a small team that works closely with adjacent technical teams. Using your technical expertise, you will enhance and maintain the database services that are essential to the smooth operation of the business. You will have the unique opportunity to influence key technical and architectural decisions for the delivery of database services.

What would your role be?


Engineering and operation of database with newest Oracle multi-tenant architecture
Engineering and operation of database with newest MS SQL-Server Releases
Support, troubleshooting and performance tuning for and with our partners
innovative projects in platform environment: design it, implement it, run it
Unlimited possibilities within automation
Working during the full life-cycle of the platforms
In our team you have the opportunity to work flexibly in the office and from home


What are we looking for?


Good English level (mandatory) and German skills (highly desirable)
Academic background in the field of computer science or comparable course of study
Solid and extensive experience with enterprise platforms and database technologies (or understanding of topics in this area), especially administration and development of Oracle multi-tenant databases (as well as MS SQL Server databases are a plus)
Conceptual and analytical skills as well as high willingness to learn
Good team player who wants to get stuck in and take responsibility
Good capability to work under pressure
Trustworthy and resilient
Willingness to work on-call


What do we offer?


We work according to agile principles, especially in our mindset and methodology, as well as work on the basis of mutual trust
Would you like to develop your skills? We are happy to support you with further trainings and certifications
Teamwork is important to us: We always exchange valuable knowledge and skills to each other - We act as one Vontobel
Our work culture is characterized by short communication channels and direct cross-departmental contact and information exchange
We offer the option for home office (flexible working times), diverse employee benefits and provide a first-class lunch menu when you work in the office at Zurich


Thank you for applying to Vontobel. We will carefully review your application and will respond to you in a timely manner.

At Vontobel, we are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

We value the many voices within our teams and are committed to creating an environment where everyone who wants to be part of our performance culture can be themselves. It is based on mutual respect and zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.

If you have any questions you can contact us through our contact form.

Title: Systems Engineer (60-100%)
Description:
Die neobix AG ist ein Jungunternehmen, welches im Jahre 2021 gegründet wurde. Als kleines Unternehmen setzen wir auf talentierte Mitarbeitende, welche den Qualitätsanspruch an sich selbst und an uns als ICT-Dienstleister hochhalten. Wir fokussieren uns auf kleine und mittlere Unternehmen und erbringen Services in den Bereichen Infrastruktur, Cloud und Security.




Als Verstärkung für unser Team sind wir auf der Suche nach einem Systems Engineer, welcher die ICT-Infrastruktur unserer Kunden sowie die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens mitgestalten möchte.







Deine Aufgaben




Als Systems Engineer darfst du bei uns folgende Aufgaben erfüllen:

Du bist verantwortlich für den 1st und 2nd Level Support und bearbeitest Kundenanfragen, die über Telefon und unser Ticketsystem eingehen
Sicherstellen, dass Kundenanfragen effizient bearbeitet werden 
Enge Zusammenarbeit im Team, um sicherzustellen, dass alle Anliegen professionell bearbeitet werden
Betreuung und Betrieb der ICT-Infrastrukturen unserer Kunden (On-Premises oder Cloud)
Kundenprojekte unterstützend planen und umsetzen
Kundenbetreuung vor Ort oder Remote und Übernahme von Support mit tiefgreifendem Troubleshooting 







Deine Skills




Als Systems Engineer bringst du folgende Skills mit:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Informatiker EFZ oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung
Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Anstellung
Fahrausweis Kategorie B
Gute Kenntnisse auf den Microsoft Plattformen (Server und Client)
Sehr gutes Bewusstsein für ICT-Sicherheit
Ausgeprägtes Verantwortungs- und Dienstleistungsbewusstsein
Hohe Eigeninitiative, vernetztes Denkvermögen, rasche Auffassungsgabe sowie Flexibilität
Belastbare eigenverantwortliche Persönlichkeit mit guten Umgangsformen
Sicheres und gepflegtes Auftreten bei Kunden
Gute Deutsch- und Englisch-Kenntnisse







Unsere Benefits




Als Systems Engineer erwarten dich folgende Benefits:

Dein ICT-Equipment darfst du zum grossen Teil selbst definieren
Abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet mit hoher Eigenverantwortung
Eine Woche Selbststudium pro Jahr in einem Thema, dass dir gefällt
40 Stundenwoche und 5 Wochen Ferien sehen wir als Standard
Bis zu 8 Wochen Ferien
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit für das Remote Arbeiten sind selbstverständlich
Show more

Title: Analista JR de Qualidade & Inovação
HTML:
O objetivo central da área de Qualidade- IA e Inovação da VP varejo do Safra é garantir eficiência e geração de receita a partir da implementação de novos fluxos de processos e tecnologia. Somos focados em análise para transformação. Também temos o desafio de fazer com que a base de clientes Safra, cresça de modo sustentável através do mapeamento de oportunidades e controle de saídas.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Responsável pelo acompanhamento Comitê de Qualidade;
  • Gestão Indicadores de Qualidade;
  • Secretariado Comitê de Qualidade;
  • PMO das iniciativas do Plano de Qualidade;


Controle e monitoramento das iniciativas de qualidade, visando aumentar a quantidade de clientes promotores e, consequentemente, seu LTV;

Oganização e mensuração de indicador de NPS e pela nota da SafraPay no canal Reclame Aqui.

Requisitos e qualificações

  • Capacidade analítica;
  • Pensamento Crítico;
  • Habilidades de Comunicação;
  • Excel Avançado;
  • PowerBI (Diferencial);
  • SQL (Diferencial);


Informações adicionais

  • Trilhas de capacitação acadêmica e técnica;
  • Oportunidade de encarreiramento;
  • Vale Refeição e Vale Alimentação;
  • Convênio médico e odontológico;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • PLR (conforme resultados do banco);
  • Condições especiais em nossos produtos financeiros;
  • Auxílio Creche / Babá;
  • Incentivo educacional;
  • Wellhub( Gympass)
  • J. Safra Clube (descontos em farmácias, lazer, bem estar e saúde, educação, colônia de férias no litoral Sul de São Paulo).

Title: Analista de Planejamento Junior | Planejamento BI
HTML:
Nossa área de Planejamento e BI

A área de Planejamento e BI do C6 Bank é responsável pela elaboração e acompanhamento dos KPIs de todos os produtos e segmentos do banco, além da consolidação dos modelos de negócio, precificação de produtos, incentivos, análises de oportunidades comerciais, análises de clientes e segmentações, desdobramento de iniciativas e apuração de resultados.

Suas atividades como CSixer

  • Estruturar e automatizar os processos ETL de bases de dados tratadas para os analistas de negócio utilizando SQL, Excel e Python;
  • Construir métricas de monitoramento de DataQuality;
  • Acompanhar qualidade dos dados através de dashboards (Looker Studio, PowerBI, etc);
  • Garantir a governança dos processos e códigos utilizados na geração das bases de dados.


Requisitos e experiência

  • Habilidade de se comunicar em níveis técnicos e comerciais, adaptando a comunicação a depender do público;
  • Capacidade de organização;
  • Interesse em trabalhar em ambiente dinâmico;
  • Conhecimento básico em manipulação de dados utilizando SQL - Obrigatório;
  • Excel intermediário - experiência com funções básicas como VLOOKUP, SUMIFS e etc;
  • Experiência com MIS, Análise e Estruturação de Dados, Business Intelligence ou Analytics.
  • Conhecimentos básicos em programação voltada a análise de dados (ex: Python, R, etc) - Diferencial;
  • Conhecimentos básicos em ferramentas de versionamento de código (ex: Bitbucket) - Diferencial.


Nossos benefícios

  • Vale-Refeição - Disponível no cartão Alelo;
  • Vale-Alimentação - Disponível no cartão Alelo;
  • Plano e saúde e odontológico - Sem copartipação e desconto para CSixers e dependentes;
  • Auxílio-Creche - reembolso para custos de creche e babá;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Gympass - Acesso a plataforma com diversos planos e modalidades esportivas;
  • Psicologia Viva - Terapia online sem custo com a opção de adesão para amigos e familiares;
  • Cartão de Crédito C6 Bank Carbon - Benefícios de ser um Carbon isento de mensalidade;
  • Carbon Spa - Salão de beleza completo localizado em nosso escritório;
  • Sala de amamentação - Espaço com toda privacidade e conforto dedicado para as CSixers;
  • Empresa Cidadã - Prorrogação do prazo da licença-maternidade e licença-paternidade;
  • Bicicletário - Local seguro para guardar a sua bicicleta no escritório;
  • Vestiário - Lockers rotativos, secador de cabelo e chuveiros;
  • Espaço de convivência - Videogame, mesa de sinuca, playball, churrasqueira, chopeira, lanchonete, auditório, diversos locais de descanso, redes, cesta de basquete e horta colaborativa e orgânica.


C6 BANK

O BANCO DA SUA VIDA

Atendemos pessoas físicas, MEIs e PMEs em todos os estados do Brasil. Sem agências físicas para te prender, oferecemos mais de 90 produtos e serviços financeiros feitos para todos os perfis de clientes.

Estamos localizados em São Paulo-SP e contamos com mais de 3.000 CSixers que estão sempre a mil por hora. Em pouco mais de cinco anos, conquistamos muitos prêmios e reconhecimentos.

Confira o vídeo para conhecer mais sobre nós:

Title: Analista Pleno de Melhoria da Experiência - Customer Experience
Description:
No Mercado Livre estamos democratizando o comércio e os serviços financeiros para transformar a vida das pessoas na América Latina. Faça parte deste propósito!




Em Customer Experience inspiramos confiança em nossos usuários, gerando experiências extraordinárias. Nos conectamos emocionalmente em cada contato, oferecendo soluções e excedendo expectativas, através de distintos canais de atendimento. Para isso, planejamos a capacidade de nossa operação, desenhamos modelos de atendimento, monitoramos a performance e gerenciamos o conhecimento de nossas equipes, com foco em gerar um impacto positivo nas experiências de milhões de pessoas, aprendendo com o mundo de e-commerce e fintech em um ambiente de trabalho desafiante e divertido!




Temos um desafio para as pessoas que:

Vibram energia empreendedora: são movidas pela curiosidade, nunca desistem e estão focadas em superar seus próprios limites.
Dão o máximo, porque adoram trabalhar com compromisso e dedicação.
Encaram as mudanças como oportunidades e aprendem com seus erros.
A excelência e a execução são primordiais na sua forma de fazer as coisas.
Promovem o bom clima, a alegria e a diversão.
Sabem como construir com outras pessoas e desfrutam trabalhando em equipe.




Imagine você empreendendo projetos desafiadores, dinâmicos e inovadores, e sendo responsável por:

Entender e antecipar os problemas dos usuários, identificando oportunidades nos processos, serviços e produtos que oferecemos e reduzindo os atritos pela raiz, quando possível.
Identificar oportunidades de melhoria com base em análise de dados e variáveis, como taxa de contato e NPS.
Gerar instâncias de melhoria contínua, quantificando os atritos e cocriando soluções para proporcionar uma experiência extraordinária com os nossos produtos.
Buscar soluções completas e eficazes para o problema do usuário que precisa entrar em contato, além de ferramentas para que a operação possa resolvê-los.
Interagir com as equipes de Produto e Negócios para seguimento, implementação e medição de iniciativas de melhoria.




Requisitos:

Ter formação Superior completa.
Possuir conhecimentos sobre Excel e PowerPoint, no nível intermediário ou avançado. Ferramentas como SQL e a elaboração de dashboards são desejáveis.
Ter comprovada experiência analítica para a resolução de problemas.
Contar com conhecimentos de nível intermediário do idioma espanhol é desejável, sendo necessário aprendê-lo ao integrar a equipe. Somos um time que olha a experiência cross sites, portanto, no dia a dia temos muita interação com pessoas e materiais em espanhol.




Nós lhe propomos:

Ser parte de uma empresa com espírito empreendedor, na qual adoramos pensar grande e em longo prazo.
Ser protagonista de seu desenvolvimento em um ambiente de oportunidades, aprendizagem, crescimento, expansão e projetos desafiadores.
Compartilhar e aprender em equipe, com excelentes profissionais e especialistas.
Um excelente clima de trabalho, com todo o necessário para você viver uma grande experiência. :)




O Mercado Livre não faz contato oferecendo oportunidades em troca de pagamento de dinheiro. Você tem acesso a todas as oportunidades abertas no nosso site de carreiras. Caso receba pedidos de dinheiro, desconfie!
